title: Opoku Nti to stay in Kotoko despite reforms
text:
Sports News | 7 October 2015 21:55 CET Opoku Nti to stay in Kotoko despite reforms - www.ghanasoccernet.com 
The Asantehene Otumfuo Osei Tutu II appointed Samuel Osei Kuffour as the new president of the club which raised doubts as to the future of the former Opoku Nti. 
But sources close to Osei Kuffour have revealed that the former Kotoko striker has been given the opportunity to determine the area he can fit well for the club. 
Opoku Nti has come under immense pressure of late following the poor performance of the club in the league and other competitions but Osie Kuffour believes his knowledge is still important for the club. 
Osei Kuffour has already concluded talks with club financier Dr. Kwaku Frimpong to become his vice while talks are also ongoing to name a seven member board as the new president meets Otumfuo tomorrow
